title: ChatGPT Go is now available in the U.S., but be prepared to see ads
body: ChatGPT Go is OpenAI's new budget subscription tier, delivering expanded usage limits, access to GPT-5.2, and enhanced memory, bridging the gap between free and premium plans.

title: ChatGPT is getting ads. Sam Altman once called them a 'last resort.'
body: The move to integrate ads into ChatGPT comes as OpenAI looks to increase its revenue amid $1.4 trillion in spending commitments and a possible IPO.

title: OpenAI says it will start testing ads on ChatGPT in the coming weeks
body: The ads will appear at the bottom of the chat window on the free and low-subscription versions of ChatGPT, OpenAI said Friday in a blog post.

title: ChatGPT's free ride is ending: Here's what OpenAI plans for advertising on the chatbot
body: SAN FRANCISCO -- OpenAI says it will soon start showing advertisements to ChatGPT users who aren't paying for a premium version of the chatbot. The artificial intelligence company said Friday it hasn't yet rolled out ads but will start testing them in the coming weeks.

title: ChatGPT's $8 subscription comes to the US: How Go compares to Plus and Pro
body: ZDNET's key takeaways OpenAI just made ChatGPT Go available in the US.The lighter version of ChatGPT's subscription costs $8 a month.Aside from the free version, OpenAI now offers three paid tiers. After testing a lighter subscription in India for four months,

title: OpenAI to test ads in ChatGPT as it burns through billions
body: According to financial documents obtained by The Wall Street Journal in November, OpenAI expects to burn through roughly $9 billion this year while generating $13 billion in revenue. Only about 5 percent of ChatGPT's 800 million weekly users pay for subscriptions, so it's not enough to cover all of OpenAI's operating costs.

title: ChatGPT Introduces Lower-Priced Subscription Tier, Ads Coming Soon
body: OpenAI today announced that its lower-priced ChatGPT Go subscription tier is now available worldwide, with U.S. pricing set at $8 per month. ChatGPT Go provides expanded access to ChatGPT's latest model,

title: OpenAI to test ads in ChatGPT in bid to boost revenue
body: OpenAI said it would start showing ads in ChatGPT to some U.S. users, ramping up efforts to generate revenue from the AI chatbot to fund the high costs of developing the technology.

title: ChatGPT can now search your entire chat history for answers
body: ChatGPT can now search through your full chat history and pull details from earlier conversations, making it easier to find things you discussed weeks or months ago, as long as you are a Plus or Pro user.

title: OpenAI Starts Testing Ads in ChatGPT
body: The company said on Friday that it would start serving ads in the free version of its chatbot over the next several weeks.

title: OpenAI releases a cheaper ChatGPT subscription
body: ﻿'ChatGPT Go' is available worldwide for $8 per month.

title: ChatGPT Health promises privacy for health conversations
body: ChatGPT Health allows users to connect medical records, Apple Health, and fitness apps for personalized health insights, OpenAI announces.

title: ChatGPT to start showing users ads based on their conversations
body: As part of the test, ads will show up at the bottom of ChatGPT's answer to a user's query and will be labeled as "sponsored." OpenAI said ads won't dictate the answers ChatGPT provides, adding that users "need to trust that ChatGPT's responses are driven by what's objectively useful."

title: ChatGPT users are about to get hit with targeted ads
body: OpenAI says that ChatGPT will maintain "answer independence," meaning that, despite the incorporation of advertising, those ads will not influence the answers that the chatbot serves to users. The company has also promised not to sell users' data to advertisers.

title: OpenAI's ChatGPT to Start Running Ads Based on Your Chatbot Conversations
body: OpenAI is about to stick ads in its popular ChatGPT application for some users -- but the company insists that it will have measures in place for protecting user privacy and ensuring trust.

title: Ads are coming to ChatGPT
body: According to OpenAI, the answers its chatbot provides to user questions will not be influenced by advertisers.

title: Cloudflare CEO Mathew Prince has a 'Google message' OpenAI: Google has a huge advantage over ChatGPT and the credit goes to
body: Cloudflare co-founder and CEO Matthew Prince has now started a debate in the AI industry with his latest claim that Google enjoys a massive advantage .

title: OpenAI's $8 ChatGPT Go is here; ads are coming too
body: OpenAI launches ChatGPT Go in the U.S., offering GPT-5.2, higher usage limits, and enhanced memory for $8/month, while testing ads in free and Go tiers.

title: ChatGPT is Getting Ads Despite Sam Altman Calling It "Uniquely Unsettling"
body: OpenAI has confirmed that ads are coming to ChatGPT, and it will roll out to Free and Go users. It's initially launching in the US in the coming weeks.

title: Ads Are Coming to ChatGPT. Here's How They'll Work
body: OpenAI says ads will not influence ChatGPT's responses, and that all ads will appear in separate, clearly labeled boxes directly below the chatbot's answer. For instance, if a user asks ChatGPT for help planning a trip to New York City,

title: ChatGPT tests ads as a new era of AI begins
body: Ads are coming to the bottom of ChatGPT's answers for certain users—as the $500 billion startup looks to offset the massive costs of offering generative AI services.

title: ChatGPT Go subscription rolls out worldwide at $8, but it'll show you ads
body: OpenAI's $8 ChatGPT Go subscription, which gives you 10x more messages, is now available in the United States and other regions.

title: ChatGPT Go is Now Available Worldwide, But Free and Go Users Will Soon See Ads
body: The cheaper ChatGPT Go plan is now available, but OpenAI will soon start testing ads in ChatGPT's Go and Free tiers, starting with the US.

title: ChatGPT is getting ads soon, starting with free users
body: ChatGPT users in the US will start seeing ads in the coming weeks unless they subscribe to the Plus or Pro tiers. The chatbot will not

title: OpenAI launches cheaper ChatGPT subscription, says ads are coming next
body: OpenAI is bringing its $8/month ChatGPT Go plan to the U.S. and says it will begin testing ads soon in the free tier and Go.

title: Ads are coming to ChatGPT soon, OpenAI announces
body: Advertisements will soon show up in both free and paid subscribers of the popular chatbot, the massive artificial technology company announced on Friday.

title: OpenAI will test ads on ChatGPT
body: According to guidelines posted by OpenAI on Friday afternoon, responses in ChatGPT will not be influenced by ads, which will be clearly labeled, and conversations will not be accessible to advertisers. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said on X changes will apply to ChatGPT free and ChatGPT Go users, who pay a monthly subscription of $8.

title: OpenAI to begin testing ads in ChatGPT in push for fresh revenue
body: The company will begin showing ads in the free version of the chatbot, as well as its cheapest subscription tier, called ChatGPT Go. Ads will appear at the bottom of ChatGPT's answers and be labeled. OpenAI's more expensive subscription tiers won't show users ads.

title: OpenAI says it is bringing ads to ChatGPT
body: OpenAI will start testing ads in ChatGPT's Free and Go tiers, letting users interact with sponsored products while keeping subscriptions ad-free.

title: Ads coming to ChatGPT for some US users
body: OpenAI has relied largely on subscriptions for revenue but could generate significant ad income from ChatGPT's estimated 800 million weekly active users. The company plans to spend more than $1 trillion on artificial intelligence infrastructure by 2030 but has not said how it will cover the costs, according to Reuters.

title: Yes, ChatGPT is getting ads — here's what that means and how to opt out
body: However, OpenAI says, "We'll always offer a way to not see ads in ChatGPT, including a paid tier that's ad-free," which suggests there might be other alternatives for turning off ads, though it's not clear right now what those might be.

title: ChatGPT to show ads amid rising costs, but some users will get exemptions
body: OpenAI, the US-based AI giant, has announced that it is starting trials to display advertisements on its widely used chatbot, ChatGPT. This move comes as the company faces rising infrastructure costs and increasing pressure to generate revenue.

title: I Asked ChatGPT the Best Way To Break Into Real Estate Investing With Only $1,000
body: To get a high-level view, I asked ChatGPT to drill down the best ways to break into real estate investing with this modest sum.
